intro: Fontainea borealis, commonly known as the northern fontainea, is a rare flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it is known for its ability to thrive in cooler climates. Botanically, it belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with similar morphological features.
